Key Match Events: Anrich Nortje took 4 wickets for 7 runs
Ottneil Baartman claimed a wicket with his first delivery
Keshav Maharaj took 2 wickets in consecutive balls
Post-Match Reflections: Sri Lanka's performance was far from the level expected in such a critical match
The team's inability to build partnerships or counter the South African bowlers' tactics was evident
This historic low for Sri Lanka in T20I cricket not only raises questions about their preparation and adaptability but also sets a daunting task for their bowlers to defend such a meager total
Miscellaneous Highlights: The New York pitch, being used for the first time in this tournament, proved challenging for the batsmen
Its inconsistent bounce and the swing on offer made scoring difficult
Moreover, the expansive outfield added to the batting side's woes, with boundaries hard to come by
Sri Lanka could only muster three fours and three sixes in their entire innings
The overall lowest total by any team in the T20 World Cup is 39, scored by the Netherlands against Sri Lanka in 2014
